> <OLD - WHEELIE>
>
> Wheelie's only experience with wildlife had been in the artificial nexuses
> created by the Quintessons, where everything had tried to consume and
> destroy everything else, where he had been such a short time ago and yet
> such a long time ago.
>
> Glancing up into the sky, as he heard the sound f the Maximals within
> mobilizing, Wheelie glanced up sadly.  It was not his place to shift the
> winds of time.
>
> It was not his place to shift the wheels of what would come or what might
> come.  No matter how much eh wished, he could not change what was to pass.
> That was for someone higher, wiser than himself to decide.
>
> Hearing the sound of the Maximals leaving the Ark, Wheelie stayed quiet, and
> stayed behind.  Watching the group as they readied themselves for whatever,
> he reamined in his place.  War, strife, fighting, was the destiny of the
> Trasnformers.  And all he could do was play his part.

<NEW>

There was a period of quiet and solitude as WHEELIE looked at the
stars and wondered at the futures for all those left on the Earth.
Then again one could not be too sure about what surprises that UNICRON
might bring. His mad insanity seemed insatiable, and he seemed at the
moment to have little care for what his ravaging could have, his
minions always seeming to watch, looking for the right moment to
attack.

"What are you doing out here." LORD ELDER said as he stood just
outside the light of the Ark looking in WHEELIE's direction. Ever
playing the role of guard and Guardian it was he and LEGACY that often
stood the long vigils over the Ark and all that were held inside.

ELDER's voice was gentle and concerned as his keen optics swept over
the area and then smiled at WHEELIE. "Tuscon and Rodimus have left and
it looks like Leo and some of the others are about to leave soon too."
ELDER's voice was wise and concerned as he approached. "What draws you
out here to look at the stars. I would have thought you would be
preparing to go with the others."

(TAG)

Preston
